metadata.title: CVE-2023-1838 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in vhost_net_set_backend indrivers/vhost/net.c in virtio network subcomponent in the Linux kernel dueto a double fget. This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash thesystem, and could even lead to a kernel information leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-224-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-224-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-224-lowlatency - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1167-aws - 4.15.0-1167.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-gcp - 4.15.0-1161.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-oracle - 4.15.0-1130.141~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1167.180~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.191~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1161.178~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.141~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
